msContents.summary: Greek fragment of the Gospel according to Matthew containing 6:5-6, 8-10, 13-15, 17

msItem.note: Hair side: 5 lines in col. i; 10 lines in col. ii
Flesh side: 11 lines in col. i; 5 lines in col. ii
Large upright uncials with carefully distinguished wide and narrow strokes
Text is apparently divided into sense units, each one commencing with a new line and an enlarged first letter (cf. Codex A)

supportDesc.support: 8 x 14.1 cm. One much-decayed, oblong fragment of a parchment leaf; the top has been cut off, the bottom worm-eaten; worm-holes across the bottom half; no traces of ruling; a series of very small, regularly spaced holes on one side, perhaps the result of binding.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt for the Egypt Exploration Fund (year unknown); donated to Princeton Theological Seminary in 1915 through an arrangment with Prof. William Park Armstrong.

div.ab: [Side 1, col. i:] They have their reward. But whenever you pray, go into your closet... [Side 1, col. ii:] for your father knows what you need before you ask him. Therefore you pray in this way: Our father who is in heaven, let your name be sanctified... [Side 2, col. i:] us into trials, but deliver us from the evil one. For if you forgive people their trespasses, your heavenly father will also forgive you; if... [Side 2, col. ii:] but you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face

listBibl.bibl: P.Oxy. 9.1169 K. Aland, Kurzgefasste Liste der griechischen Handschriften des Neuen Testaments (Berlin: De Gruyter, 1994), 34.
